about_paragraph_1_1: This app is made for fans of the game theHunter™ Call of the Wild. App offers info about species huntable in the game. There is also info about weapons and callers usable in the game for hunting.
about_paragraph_1_2: Interactive maps are in progress. Animal zones are only approximate and they do not really have to be same with your animal population on your single player maps. So count with it and take those zones just as sort of a guide.
about_paragraph_1_3: All game icons, maps, animal's heads and their anatomy are remade by myself. All is taken from the game as a screenshot and vectorized. All the info about species etc. is taken mostly from the game itself. More detailed information, like maximum trophy score or fur rarity, is taken from various spreadsheets or game guides on Steam. Feel free to contact me about misleading info.
about_paragraph_1_4: This is not an official app. Many things are missing, so please be patient till next updates. Thank you!
about_paragraph_2: To be honest, this app took some pretty great amount of time to make. So if you really like it and you would like to support me, please consider donating. I am not forcing anybody to anything. It will be just your free choice. But if you even then choose to donate, it will be really, really appreciated. The link is down below. The payment is processed through PayPal. Thank you!
about_paragraph_3: My native language is Czech and translations to other languages except English are a bit challenging for me. Keep in mind, that not everything will be translated properly. I am still working on fur types translations. If you would like to help me with this, I would be very grateful. My email address can be found below.
best_weapons: Show only the best weapons for animals
date_of_record: Show the date of the record
error_no_chosen_item: You have to choose at least one item.
error_no_name: You have to set a name.
error_wrong_name: Name can contain only alphanumeric characters, underscore, or dash.
file_not_exported: The file could not be exported.
file_not_imported: The file could not be imported.
logbook_info_2_1: You can search for records by *two* criteria. By *name* and *trophy*. You have to use '*|*' to divide the criteria.
logbook_info_2_2: Example 1: You can search for '*red deer*' - this will filter records with Red Deer.
logbook_info_2_3: Example 2: You can search for '*<200*' - this will filter records with trophy less than 200 inclusive.
logbook_info_2_4: Example 3: You can search for '*red deer|>200|brown*' - this will filter records with Red Deer and Brown Bear having trophy greater than 200 inclusive.
logbook_info_2_5: Example 4: You can search for '*red deer|<50|brown|mouf|>20*' - this will filter records with Red Deer, Brown Bear, and Iberian Mouflon having trophy between 20 and 50 inclusive.
logbook_info_2_6: Example 5: You can search for '*200|red deer|brown|mouf*' - this will filter records with Red Deer, Brown Bear, and Iberian Mouflon having trophy exactly 200.
logbook_info_2_7: Keep in mind, that there can be max *two* numbers, and *any number* of names. Priority: name *>* greater,lesser *>* equals. Everything else will be ignored.
logbook_info_3_3: You can sort records by *multiple* criteria. You can for example sort records by name and then by trophy. *Numbers* tell you what criteria are used first, second, and third. *Arrows* tell you if you set ascended or descended order. For *reverse order* use the sort button again.
logbook_info_5_1: You will be asked if you agree with removing all records.
logbook_info_5_2: You can also remove records *one by one* by *double-tapping* the record.
logbook_info_6_1: You can move records to or remove them from the lodge by swiping the record to the *left*. Only records created in the *catch book* can be moved to or removed from the lodge.
logbook_info_7_1: You can edit the record by swiping it to the *right*.
logbook_info_8_2: You can export the records as one file to your device's storage. The created file will be a *.json* with all the records you added to the catch book and trophy lodge and will be saved to the *Download* folder. I do not recommend editing the file on your own or at all. You can lose all the records if you do something wrong.
logbook_info_8_3: You can also import the file back into the app. If the file will not have the needed structure, it will not be loaded. The file has to have the *.json* at the end of its name. The imported file will *overwrite* everything created so far.
logbook_info_8_4: You will have to *allow access to the storage*. There is no other way. If you do not allow this, the app will not be able to create and save the file to or import the file from your device's storage. On the other hand, the records will still be saved in the app's storage as long as the app will be installed on your device. If you do not like the permission allowed all the time, you can always manually disallow this permission in the device's settings.
map_zones_style: Show animals occurrences as circles in map
name: Name
remove_all_items: Are you sure you want to remove all records?
